info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 05 at 6:01AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER. * WHAT...AVALANCHE WARNING. THE AVALANCHE DANGER IS HIGH. HEAVY DENSE SNOW ALONG WITH STRONG WINDS AND THE POTENTIAL FOR RAIN- ON-SNOW AT LOWER ELEVATIONS WILL CREATE DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS. * WHERE...BEAR RIVER RANGE AND IDAHO PORTION OF THE NORTHERN WASATCH RANGE. * WHEN...6 AM MST WEDNESDAY THROUGH 6 AM MST THURSDAY. * IMPACTS...NATURAL AND HUMAN-TRIGGERED AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY ACROSS MANY ASPECTS AND ELEVATIONS. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... BACKCOUNTRY TRAVELERS SHOULD STAY OFF OF, AND OUT FROM UNDERNEATH, SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES. AVALANCHES MAY RUN LONG DISTANCES AND CAN RUN INTO MATURE FORESTS. CHOOSE CONSERVATIVE TERRAIN. CONSULT WWW.UTAHAVALANCHECENTER.ORG OR CALL 1-888-999-4019 FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION. SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER.
